citation.article-title: A new genus of the order Actinomycetales, Cryptosporangium gen. nov., with descriptions of Cryptosporangium arvum sp. nov. and Cryptosporangium japonicum sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Cryptosporangium arvum sp. nov.
Cryptosporangium arvum (ar.vum. L. n. arvum arable land, pertaining to isolate from arable land)
Morphological, chemotaxonomic and general characteristics are as given above for the genus.
Pale reddish-brown soluble pigment is produced on tyrosine agar (ISP medium 7).
Xylose, glucose, inositol, raffinose, rhamnose, mannitol, sucrose, arabinose, glycerol, lactose, maltose and mannose are utilized, but sorbitol and inulin are not.
As major cellular fatty acids, iso-C16:0, C18:1, C17:1, C17:0 and C16:0 are present.
The G+C content of DNA is 70 mol%.
The type strain is YU 629-21T (= IFO 15965T).
